channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-3727] MultiHFileOutputFormat
item.description: Like MultiTableOutputFormat, but outputting HFiles. Key is tablename as an IBW. Creates sub-writers (code cut and pasted from HFileOutputFormat) on demand that produce HFiles in per-table subdirectories of the configured output path. Does not currently support partitioning for existing tables / incremental update.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Need to commit task.

Its 2011 (for copyright). Add a class comment saying what this output format does. Can you factor out the common code Andrew rather than copy/paste? You know that there will be a bug in the copied code as soon as you commit! Else looks good. You going to commit?
I want to run this for a bit and see if more is needed.
Andrew Purtell Still interested in finishing this?
I'm not using it. Is there any interest in it in general?

We have a good use case for this, Andrew. Arun Singh, an open source contributor to Phoenix, is writing a bulk CSV loader for Phoenix. We'd like to get it working efficiently for the scenario where a data table has indexes. The indexes are themselves HBase tables (essentially partial copies of the data table with a different row key structure) with the same column family structure as the data table. With this feature you've added, we can do the data table and index table creation in a single map-reduce run. Otherwise, we have to do one map-reduce run per data table + index tables which is obviously suboptimal.

Any chance we could get this into a patch on 0.94?
+1 to what James says here. We also have a need for something similar. Is it possible to include this patch in next release ? Or are there any concerns ?
The patch on this issue is about two years stale. This should be redone if needed.
This can probably be used outside of HBase (i.e. without any HBase core changes).
I also fear that this would give raise to a new discussion about new features in old releases.
I have not seen any activity on this jira. is it fine if I pick it up?
It is unassigned. Pls go ahead and assign to ur name and work on patch. Good on you NIDHI GAMBHIR

This Patch is for MultiHFileOutputFormat,
it now only support default compression algorithm and default block size;
Not support:
1. Customized Compression algorithm for column family and BloomFilter
2. Not support DataBlockEncoding
3. No partitioner, can only create one file for each column family, can not create multiple files by regions for one column family, i will then create a new jira to support all of them.

Since we now have this MultiHFileOutputFormat, we can develop some new features, below is what I can think about:
1. MultiHFileOutputFormat support Customized compression algorithm, data block encoding and implement partitioner(just like HFileOutputFormat2 support all of above)

2. MultiHFileOutputFormat unit test

3. ImportTsv: This can only support read tsv file and output HFiles for one table, maybe we can make it support read tsv file(may be contain <table names, keyvalue> in each row) and output HFiles for multiple tables, so then can be loaded into different tables(this need more discussion)

4. CompleteBulkLoad: Only support for one table now, if we give a directory contains several tables. This tool can automatically load data into different tables

5. WAL Player: this tool can generate HFile for later bulk loading, but in that case only a single table and no mapping can be specified. Now we can support multiple tables, if we use MultiHFileOutputFormat in this class to output HFiles for Multiple tables, and then we can use above CompleteBulkLoad to load data to different tables

Can you add a unit test ?

Putting patch on review board would be appreciated.

-1 overall

will provide unit test soon, thanks

new patch is attached, including unit test,
Ted Yu Andrew Purtell could you help to review the code. Thanks

Thanks for the patch Yi Liang. But the patch is mostly based on the existing HFileOutputFormat2 and duplicates lots of the code from it. Could be possible to refactor MultiHFileOutputFormat to use HFileOutputFormat instead?

Hi Esteban Gutierrez
it is possible to refactor MultiHFileOutputFormat to use HFileOutputFormat2 for most part, but i need to change the original code of HFileOutputFormat2, because the current HFileOutputFormat2 can not be extended easily. I will give a patch, so you can see which way is better. Thanks for your advice.

Attached is revised version, MH3.patch
To use existing code in the HFileOutputFormat2.java, I need to modify the original code in HFileOutputFormat2. There are only one major modification in HFileOutputFormat2: change the Anonymous Classes of return RecordWriter to HFileRecordWriter extends RecordWriter.
In this way, I can directly new HFileRecordWriter in my MultiHFileOutputFormat.java.
And I also put the code on the review board, thanks
the new file are MH3.patch, and all xxxx__3.java

@Yi:
There is no need to attach individual classes as Java files.
The patch would suffice.

HBASE-3727 MultiHFileOutputFormat (yi liang) (jerryjch: rev 60847a2d76163ff40df94a980e1bd3f837ff9d71)

  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/mapreduce/TestMultiHFileOutputFormat.java

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
MultiHFileOutputFormat support output of HFiles from multiple tables. It will output directories and hfiles as follow,
     --table1
       --family1
       --family2
         --Hfiles
     --table2
       --family3
         --hfiles
       --family4

family directory and its hfiles match the output of HFileOutputFormat2
